page.title: 06HOUSING - PETWORTH RURAL NE
page.content: Farmhouses and cottages on the Leconfield Estate, west of the main road, have tenant occupiers and are old properties. Gownfold farmhouse is partly 14th century. The houses are maintained by the Estate. Among the trees and bracken on Brickkiln Common, new detached houses, privately owned, are chamging the character of that part of the area. Bulchins Farm is a very old house. In the 18th century it was the 'Royal Oak', on a main road from London to Littlehampton. The kitchen is now being enlarged. Medhone and Shipbourne farmhouses are no more. Medhone has been destroyed as no longer required, and Shipbourne Farmhouse was burned to the ground. Omly a farm cottage remains, reached by a gravel track in a bad state of repair. The tenant's hobby is growing old English roses.
